intro: Sarcanthus arietinus, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, elongated fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and dry forests. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic and practical properties.
